RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 79. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RISK IT showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, drew off under a drive to prevail. HUNT BALL got bumped at the start behind REMEMBER THE NAME by MIDDLE MARKET breaking inwards and conceded four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased along the inside until tipped to the two path half a mile from home, tipped three wide midway on the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths and then angled four wide into upper stretch offering up a bid, then chased the winner home clear of the rest to be along second best. SPECIAL ELEMENT got away to an awkward first step, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. MIDDLE MARKET broke in brushing the near side stall and then bumping HUNT BALL, conceded four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, went six wide into upper stretch and improved position to just miss for the show honors on the wire. ACT OF MUTINY four wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, weakened in the stretch. WORLD FAIR shied in at the start filling the space left vacant by MIDDLE MARKET, chased two to three wide down the backstretch and then three to four wide through the turn getting placed to coaxing with five-sixteenths to go, angled in to spin just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. REMEMBER THE NAME bobbled at the break, came under hustling and chased just off the inside until tucked inside half a mile from home, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Risk It
ENTRY.OWNER: Winchell Thoroughbreds LLC and Three Chimneys Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, ins turn, set down 2w 1/4p, drew off

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Gun Runner Syndicate, De Sousa Stables& Cranford Bloodstoc

ENTRY.NAME: Remember the Name
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, hustled, chased 2p, to ins 1/2, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Hunt Ball
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, coaxed, ins early, 2-3w turn, 4w upper, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Middle Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in, brush gate, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, 6w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: World Fair
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3-4w 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Act of Mutiny
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, coaxed 7/16, angled 4-5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Special Element
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, 3w upper, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANCING GROOM went three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, ranged up four wide on the far turn, was roused outside the quarter-pole, dropped to the three path while sweeping to the front into the stretch then kicked clear, drew away under a drive into the final seventy yards then was eased up late while much the best. HOULTON saved ground on the first turn, moved up early on the backstretch, was well placed just off the pace, drafted in the two path on the far turn, shifted three wide outside the quarter-pole then came four wide into the stretch, pursued the winner under a drive into the final furlong and proved no match while clear for the place. DIVINE EMPIRE was hustled from the gate, traveled around the opening bend in the two path while under some extra left-rein pressure, was rated just off the pace, moved to the lead in the two path early on the far turn, lost the advantage to the winner into the stretch and weakened but was clear for the show. ROCKET NIGHT broke out and was off a step slow, went six wide early on the first turn then dropped to the two path, settled on the inside of a foe while towards the rear, started the far turn in the two path then was roused three wide, shifted five wide later on that bend and failed to threaten. DANGEROUS DRIVER rounded the first turn in the three path, settled on the inside, saved ground while urged along on the far turn and failed to respond. TOM COLLINS went to the front, raced inside on the first turn, showed the way off the rail on the backstretch, lost the lead just inside the seven-sixteenths, vied inside under urging on the far turn, dropped back into the stretch and tired. GET READY TO ROCK went four wide on the first turn, settled towards the back on the outside, was urged three then four wide on the far turn and was no factor. SKYLER'S ARTEMIS bumped with a foe at the start, was urged in the two path on the first turn, raced just off the pace between foes, was roused while dropping back near the nine-sixteenths, rounded the far turn in the two path and retreated. BLAST FURNACE leaned in at the start and bumped with a foe then was hustled, went four wide on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, chased in the three path on the far turn, dropped back late on that bend and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Houlton
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st,well placed,2p2nd,shift3w out1/4,4w into lane,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Tom Collins
ENTRY.OWNER: Janney, III, Stuart S. and Phipps Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside pace,headed inside 7/16,urged5/16,drop back1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,2p1st,rated,lead 2p ins7/16,headed into lane,wknd,clr3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Dancing Groom
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,settled,ranged up 4w2nd,roused1/4,took over 3p3/16,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Skyler's Artemis
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,urged 2p1st,btwn,just off pace,drop back4-1/2,retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Blast Furnace
ENTRY.COMMENT: leaned in brk,bmpd,hustled,4w1st,trckd out,chsd 3p2nd,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Dangerous Driver
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st turn,settled inside,urged rail 2nd turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Get Ready to Rock
ENTRY.OWNER: America's Pastime Stables Bouchey Steven Red Diamond Stable Nedlaw Stable and Sl
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w1st,settled outside,urged 3-4w2nd turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Rocket Night
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bit slw,drp 6-2p1st trn,settled ins foe,2-5p2nd,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 5 1/2F Turf CR: 91. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHOOTOUTTHELIGHTS broke out at the start bumping DONTLOOKBACKATALL in tandem with YOU GOTTA HAVE FUN due to pressure from MISS DOMINA, showed the way in hand along the inside through swift splits, got set down taking the two path into upper stretch, drifted out a path under a drive while holding well to the finish. DONTLOOKBACKATALL got bumped between foes at the start who each came her way and was pinched back lightly conceding two to three lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased just off the inside from near the rear of the field patiently handled until let out angled five wide into upper stretch, rallied with good energy to latch on the winner as she hit the finish. MY SWEET AFFAIR chased along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive running on to the finish to preserve the show honors. VIOLET GIBSON (IRE) chased three then two wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled out six wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid. GEORGEES SPIRIT coaxed from the start, chased along the inside coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, took the inside route into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. NUMERO SEIS stumbled at the start conceding two lengths to the front, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. MISS DOMINA broke in at the start bumping YOU GOTTA HAVE FUN into DONTLOOKBACKATALL, chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking three wide through the turn getting placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and weakened. YOU GOTTA HAVE FUN (IRE) got bumped at the start by the aforementioned foe breaking inwards and in turn bumped with DONTLOOKBACKATALL getting pinched between due to pressure inside from SHOOTOUTTHELIGHTS, who broke outwards, came under brief coaxing and chased three then two wide before coming under coaxing once more three furlongs from home, cornered three wide at the head of the stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: My Sweet Affair
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and Gatsas Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, dug in, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Domina
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and Reeves Thoroughbred Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, 4-5w early, coaxed 3w 3/8, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Georgees Spirit
ENTRY.OWNER: Abreu Jorge R Photos Finish LLC and Sportsmen Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, inside 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Violet Gibson (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed near 1/4, angled 6w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Numero Seis
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Shootoutthelights
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, in hand ins, set down 2w 1/4p, drifted, held well

ENTRY.NAME: Dontlookbackatall
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Scarlet Oak Racing and Titletown Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped betw st, chased 2p, let out 5w upper, good energy

ENTRY.NAME: You Gotta Have Fun (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped betw st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 97. Claiming Purse 42000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POPPY'S PRIDE angled in while going to the front, showed the way with a clear advantage, raced inside on the turn, was challenged near the five-sixteenths, responded well when put to a right-handed crop in upper stretch, fought on even terms for the advantage into the final furlong, shook clear into the final sixteenth and prevailed under steady urging. HANDSOME CAT bumped lightly with rivals on both sides at the start then tossed his head while taken up early, tossed his head again when the rider fell back in the saddle briefly near the nine-sixteenths, moved from three to five wide while lugging out some on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch, gained outside into the final furlong, chased under a right-handed crop into the final sixteenth and got up for the place. QUICKFLASH chased the pace down the backstretch, raced in the two path on the turn, made a bid between horses at the five-sixteenths, battled under a drive while on even terms for the lead in upper stretch, fought with the winner to near the sixteenth-pole then weakened and was caught for the place while clear for the show. FLAMINGO HAWK made light contact with a foe at the start, was urged along while well back in the field, went three then four wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and improved position. AIR SHOW was hustled from the gate, chased the pace on the outside then three wide on the turn, made a bid outside of two foes at the five-sixteenths, turned into upper stretch under the crop, dropped back into the final furlong and tired. RAGTIME BLUES chased the pace down the backstretch, dropped back at the seven-sixteenths pole, saved ground on the turn, shifted three wide into the stretch and came up empty. IN SKY WE TRUST broke a half-step slow, was urged along towards the rear, went four then three wide on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and failed to respond. ENSIGN PARKER made light contact with an opponent at the start, was coaxed along off the pace, moved from the rail to the two path on the turn, came out near the furlong marker and lacked the needed response. GREAT WORKOUT broke a bit slow, angled in at the rear of the field, went two then three wide on the turn, swung six wide into the stretch and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Ensign Parker
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,coaxed along,ins-2p turn,mvd out 1/8,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Handsome Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,tkn up,rider fall back4-1/2,3-5w turn,6w1/4,gained,up2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Flamingo Hawk
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,well back,3-4w turn,5w into lane,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Ragtime Blues
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,drop back 7/16,ins turn,3w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: In Sky We Trust
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 step slow,urged along,4-3p turn,mvd out 3/16,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Poppy's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,clear pace,ins turn,challenged5/16,responded,held

ENTRY.NAME: Quickflash
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,2p turn,bid btwn5/16,vied to 1/16,wknd,lost 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Air Show
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,chased outside,3w turn,bid5/16,drop back 1/8,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Great Workout
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,angled in,2-3p turn,6p into lane,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 102. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DURANTE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand three then two wide, came under challenge near the quarter pole and got set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, rebuffed the challenge and drew clear under a drive to prevail. DAUFUSKIE ISLAND hustled from the gate, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, offered up a bid to issue a challenge spinning two to three wide into upper stretch, then got repelled by the top one and ran on to be along clear for the place honors. LAFITTE'S FLEET got brushed at the start by ABADIN, who broke outwards, chased just off the inside until tucked inside placed to coaxing near the half mile pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. ABADIN broke out at the start brushing the aforementioned foe and was taken in hand conceding three to four lengths to the front, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went five wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. A LA CARTE hustled from the gate, chased four wide throughout under coaxing from midway on the turn and weakened in the stretch. NOTABLE BOB (CHI) chased four to five wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued four to five wide into upper stretch, made no impact. HARRINGTON chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, tipped three to four wide into upper stretch, faltered, and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Lafitte's Fleet
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R Speranza Steven and GRC Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, chased 2p, coaxed ins 1/2, 2w 1/4p, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Daufuskie Island
ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Cotrone Robert
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 3w, coaxed 5/16, bid 2-3w uppr, repelled

ENTRY.NAME: Harrington
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, faltered, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Abadin
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Diamonds Farm and Main Line Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: A La Carte
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Notable Bob (CHI)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CHS

ENTRY.OWNER: Arenas Marcelo and Senoret Verdugo Victor
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 4-5w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Durante
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 3-2w, set down ins 1/4, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 71. Maiden Claiming Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwi se Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LEADERSHIP ABILITY was hustled to the front, dropped from the three path to the two path on the first turn, showed the way down the backstretch, controlled the action while inside to the two path on the far turn, responded well when asked coming to the quarter-pole, hugged the rail into the stretch, drew off under a strong hand-ride into the final furlong, was given one pop of a right-handed crop in the vicinity of the sixteenth-pole and proved much the best. BERNING HONOR bumped with a rival at the start then was hustled, was rated on the inside, came under urging on the far turn, was driven into the stretch in the two path and earned the place while no match for the winner. MUCHO MAMA MIA was carried out to around the nine path on the first turn, settled on the outside, was urged four wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and missed the place while just up for the show. JAYLA went three wide while between horses on the first turn, was rated just off the pace, rounded the far turn in the two path, was roused between horses at the five-sixteenths then driven three wide into the stretch and just missed the show. FLUTIE FLAKES broke out and bumped with a foe, went four wide on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, chased three wide on the far turn, was driven four wide into the stretch and came up empty. DREAM ROAD bumped with a rival at the start, was taken up while too close to the rail early, saved ground on the first turn, settled well off the pace, was urged along passing the nine-sixteenths, went two then three wide on the far turn and was no factor. PINSTRIPEPIZZO went three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was urged three to four wide on the far turn and faltered. LIEUTENANT'SLEGACY was bumped at the start and forced out, checked while bearing out badly on the first turn, reached around the ten path late on that bend, dropped well behind the rest of the field, saved ground on the far turn and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Berning Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: Rosenthal, Robert D. and Bernstein, Bradford H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,hustled,rated ins,ask2nd turn,2p1/4,no match,earned2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Dream Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,tkn up early,ins1st,settled,urged5/8,2-3p2nd,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Pinstripepizzo
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w1st turn,settled,3-4w2nd turn,no response,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Jayla
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,rated btwn,2p2nd turn,roused5/16,lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Leadership Ability
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,3-2p1st,showed way,ins-2p2nd,ask1/4,drew off,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Flutie Flakes
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bmpd,4w1st,tracked outside,urged 3w2nd turn,4w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Lieutenant'slegacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,bore out bad1st,checked,10w,well behind,ins2nd,trail

ENTRY.NAME: Mucho Mama Mia
ENTRY.COMMENT: carried out 9wide 1st turn,settled out,urged 4w2nd,5w,earn show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Lake Placid S. - Grade2 SARATOGA RACE 7 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 101. Stakes Purse 200000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ASPRAY leaned outwards brushing the off side stall at the start, settled tracking along the inside through the first turn before taking to the two path down the backstretch, tucked inside at the nine-sixteenths and rode the rail through the far turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled four wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command just inside the three-sixteenths and edged clear under a drive to prevail. SURGE CAPACITY broke in at the start bumping SOVIET EXCESS, tracked the pace along the inside from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch at the quarter pole, then tipped out to the five path with three-sixteenths to go and ran on to chase the winner home securing the place honors while unable to cut into her margin through the final furlong. SOVIET EXCESS got bumped at the start by the aforementioned foe breaking inward, settled just off the inside at the tail of the field, remained patiently handled along the inside until placed to coaxing nearing the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, tipped out nearing the eighth pole to the four path in behind SURGE CAPACITY and was denied a nudge against TAX IMPLICATIONS bumping with that foe a furlong from home, then got clearance when the rival in front drifted in and offered up a mild kick to secure the show honors in the final jumps. TAX IMPLICATIONS (GB) settled unhurried along the inside through the first turn before tipping three wide down the backstretch, tucked to the two path nearing the far turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, tipped out to the five path following the move by SURGE CAPACITY in front with three-sixteenths to go, had SOVIET EXCESS tip out along her inside and got bumped when holding her lane keeping that rival in behind SURGE CAPACITY briefly, then offered up a mild kick but was just bested for the show honors in the last strides. PREREQUISITE four then three wide into the first turn, chased three to four wide down the backstretch and through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, passed tired rivals while keeping on one paced to the finish. GLORIA'S PRINCESS brushed the off side stall at the start, attended the leader from the outside two to three wide, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch taking over narrow and brief command straightened away before being displaced by the eventual winner at the three-sixteenths, then weakened in the final furlong. HEAVENLY SUNDAY coaxed from the gate, showed the way under a rating hold along the inside through the first turn and then just off the inside down the backstretch under the watchful eyes of GLORIA'S PRINCESS to the outside but facing little pressure save from her presence until midway on the far turn, had that rival get busy nearing the quarter pole and responded in kind getting set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, yielded the front straightened away and weakened. JUNIPERMARSHMALLOW broke out a step at the start, raced three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide for home, tired, and was eased through the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Heavenly Sunday
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, rated 2p, to ins 1/2, set down 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Aspray
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, tracked 2p, to ins 9/16, 4w upper, up 3/16, edged clr

ENTRY.NAME: Gloria's Princess
ENTRY.OWNER: Harvey A Clarke Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed gate, attended 3-2w, 3w upper, up str away, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Tax Implications (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins 1st turn, 3-2w near rear, 3w uppr, bumped 1/8, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Junipermarshmallow
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 3w 1st turn, chased 4-3w, 4w upper, tired, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Soviet Excess
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 2p at rear, 2w 1/4p, tip 4p 1/8, bumped, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Surge Capacity
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4, tip 5p 3/16, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Prerequisite
ENTRY.OWNER: First Row Partners and Team Hanley
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w into 1st turn, 3-4w pursuit, 5w upper, passed tired foes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 101. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 162500. (PURSE $125,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $28,275 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE N OT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80, 000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOSTALGIC rushed the front of the gate just before the latch was sprung but broke with the field, went four wide on the first turn, settled comfortably off the pace, was roused three then four wide on the far turn, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed strongly to get the lead inside the furlong marker and proved best under good handling. GERRYMANDER bumped with a rival at the start, saved ground while taken in hand on the first turn, was keen off heels late on that bend and early on the backstretch, raced just off the pace under restraint, moved from the rail to the two path on the far turn, was given a clear opening between foes at the quarter-pole, rallied to get the lead in upper stretch, led under a drive into the final furlong but was overtaken while clear for the place. MISTY VEIL veered out at the start and was off a bit slow, went five wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside under a snug hold, made a bid leaving the backstretch, vied in the three then four path on the far turn, dropped back while lugging in some near the furlong marker and weakened but was clear for the show. ROYAL TAKE CHARGE prompted the pace on the outside in the two to three path, was given her cue between foes on the far turn, had the rider lose his crop at the top of the stretch, dropped back under a strong hand-ride into the final furlong and tired. FAVOR was hustled to the front, raced in the two path for most of the first turn then dropped to the rail, showed the way down the backstretch, was asked while inside on the far turn, had the rider lose his crop at the top of the stretch, lost the lead under a drive near the three-sixteenths and gave way. MOSIENKO went three then two wide on the first turn, was reserved at the rear, went four then five wide under urging on the final turn, was driven six wide into the stretch and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Gerrymander
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,ins1st,keen7/8,rated,ins-2p2nd,bid btwn3/16,led,overtaken

ENTRY.NAME: Favor
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front,2p-ins1st,pace,ask rail2nd,headed3/16,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Take Charge
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted outside,2-3path,btwn2nd turn,lost crop1/4,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mosienko
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2p1st,reserved at rear,urged 4-5w2nd turn,6w1/4,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Nostalgic

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Alabama S. Presented by Keeneland Sales - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 9 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 106. Stakes Purse 600000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $600 each which should accompany the nomination; $4,500 to pass the entry box and an additional $4,500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $3,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth , 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 121 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. Closed Saturday, August 5, 2023 with 16 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RANDOMIZED established the front breaking away well from the gate and showed the way in hand just off the inside through the first turn and then three wide down the backstretch, continued three wide through the far turn getting placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths with DEFINING PURPOSE giving closest chase, angled five wide into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to prevail. WET PAINT chased just off the pace along the inside throughout, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued along the inside into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on to secure the place honors. DEFINING PURPOSE broke out at the start and was corrected, raced three wide through the first turn forwardly placed in closest aim of the leader, chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. SABRA TUFF stumbled at the start recovering outwards and bumped and squeezed back FIRELINE in tandem with CHOCOLATE GELATO, chased along the inside from near the rear of the field coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and passed tired rivals to the finish. TAXED stumbled at the start recovering inwards a step, raced to the outside of GAMBLING GIRL and tucked directly in front impeding that rival just outside nine and a half furlongs to go about seventy yards into the race and was clipped behind by that foe, raced six paths off the inside past the stands before tucking three wide through the first turn, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path through the far turn coaxed along from the seven-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and tired. GAMBLING GIRL bobbled heavily after the start when clipping the back heels of TAXED as that foe tucked directly in front impeding her near seventy yards into the race, lost two to three lengths of ground recovering before settling just off the inside through the first turn near the rear of the field, chased two to three wide down the backstretch, came under coaxing just off the inside at the seven-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, tired and was reported to have bled. SACRED WISH stumbled at the start striking the off side stall, raced four wide past the stands the initial time and through the first turn and then five wide down the backstretch, tucked three wide half a mile from home placed to coaxing, went five to six wide into upper stretch and faltered. FIRELINE got bumped at the start by SABRA TUFF and then got squeezed out between foes, raced two to three wide before tucking inside through the first turn and down the backstretch, tipped two to three wide through the far turn, went three wide into upper stretch and gave way. JULIA SHINING just off the inside through the first turn, chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, went five to six wide into upper stretch and was eased home to the finish. CHOCOLATE GELATO coaxed from the gate, chased sluggish and went five wide through the first turn, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide into the far turn, tucked to the two path eased up and cornered just off the inside into upper stretch and remained eased home to the finish. There was a Stewards' Inquiry into just after the start as well as a Claim of foul by the rider of GAMBLING GIRL alleging interference against TAXED after the start. After review, TAXED was disqualified from fifth and placed sixth prior to the race being declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: Sacred Wish
ENTRY.OWNER: Black Type Thoroughbreds Swinbank Stables Adkisson Steve Dunn Christopher T and

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 1M Inner turf CR: 109. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. INNER TURF (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE O F $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare As sessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUKE OF HAZZARD (FR) was well placed while rated on the inside, drafted along the rail on the far turn, shifted to the two path at the quarter-pole, took the lead while asked for his best in upper stretch, fought outside of the runner-up to the finish and proved best under strong urging. CALL ME HARRY was hustled to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage under a drive in upper stretch, fought on with the winner into the final sixteenth but was outfinished while able to hold the place. WHISPER NOT (GB) went around the first turn in the two path, was unhurried towards the rear, shifted from the rail to the two path late on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch then moved further out and finished willingly for the show. RUNNINGWSCISSORS hit the outside of the gate then bumped with a foe and was off slow, went four wide on the first turn, was reserved near the back, traveled three wide on the far turn, shifted four wide at the quarter-pole, was hesitantly ridden while behind foes in upper stretch, came under urging outside the furlong marker and improved position without threatening. STORM THE COURT was taken under a tight hold early, rounded the first turn in the two path, stalked the pace on the outside down the backstretch, was asked while two then three wide on the far turn and lacked the needed response. NAPOLEONIC WAR tugged on the bit while keen under restraint in the two then three path on the first turn, was rated towards the front, came under urging while moving from the two path to the four path on the final turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and also lacked the needed response. VERBAL went three then four wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside, traveled two then three wide on the far turn, was roused five wide into the stretch and failed to rally. MAXWELL ESQUIRE dropped from the three path to the rail on the first turn, settled at the rear, saved ground under urging on the far turn and failed to threaten. FLOKI'S FLIGHT bumped with a rival at the start then was hustled, went around the first turn in the four path, was forwardly placed on the outside, dropped back while drifting well out in the course going around the far turn and faltered then was pulled up in the stretch then vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Duke of Hazzard (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed in hand,inside,shift 2p1/4,lead3/16,proved best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Runnymede Farm Inc. & Catesby W. Clay

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Maiden Claiming Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be V oid). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HENSON bobbled at the break, dueled early from the three path with KERN RIVER to his inside, shook off that rival near the seven-sixteenths and tucked to the two path to show the way in sole command, swung four wide into upper stretch coming under challenge to the inside, got roused with three-sixteenths to run, repelled the bid from the runner up and inched clear inside the final sixteenth to prevail. OKALOOSA broke out at the start, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, offered up a bid challenging for the front a furlong out, got repelled by the top one and ran on well clear of the rest to secure the place honors. KERN RIVER hustled from the gate, dueled from the two path with HENSON to his outside, tucked inside and gave chase through the turn, spun two to three wide for home and stayed on one paced to the finish to preserve the show honors. SPOOFY four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. BLUE PLATE SPECIAL broke out at the start bumping PETROLO, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch, made no headway through the final furlong. PETROLO got bumped at the start by BLUE PLATE SPECIAL, who broke outwards, chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went eight to nine wide into upper stretch and made no late headway. MAJESTIC ARC three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, went five wide into upper stretch and tired. HERONEANDONLY lost his footing at the start, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and tired. IMPULSIVE SPENDING coaxed from the start, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and tired. SOMAMA BEACH coaxed from the gate, chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went six to seven wide into upper stretch and tired. ONOFRIO broke sluggish from the gate and quickly grew detached at the tail of the field while just off the inside, went two to three wide through the turn continuing to lose ground, cornered four to five wide into upper stretch well behind the rest and distanced and trailed throughout, then walked off under his own power.
